intro: Paepalanthus globulifer, commonly known as the globular ice plant, is a member of the Aizoaceae family. It is a succulent shrub characterized by its fleshy, thick leaves and small, clustered flowers. Native to South America, particularly Argentina and Chile, it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant produces numerous small, round fruits that are often used as ornamental elements in gardens. Its unique appearance and ability to store water make it well adapted to harsh, dry climates.
